inference:
Solution:
The pyramid has four slant edges, each of which is the hypotenuse of a right triangle with legs of length 5 cm (half the side length of the square base) and 12 cm (the height of the pyramid). 
The Pythagorean Theorem tells us that the length of each slant edge is $\sqrt{5^2 + 12^2} = 13$ cm.
The sum of the lengths of the four slant edges is $4 \cdot 13 = 52$ cm.
The sum of the lengths of the four base edges is $4 \cdot 10 = 40$ cm.
The total sum of the lengths of all eight edges is $52 + 40 = 92$ cm.

Final Answer: $\boxed{92}$. I hope it is correct.
